trans-unit.source: How to Use iOS SDK for Azure Mobile Apps
trans-unit.target: How to Use iOS SDK for Azure Mobile Apps

trans-unit.source: How to Use iOS SDK for Azure Mobile Apps
trans-unit.target: How to Use iOS SDK for Azure Mobile Apps

trans-unit.source: How to Use iOS Client Library for Azure Mobile Apps
trans-unit.target: How to Use iOS Client Library for Azure Mobile Apps

trans-unit.source: This guide teaches you to perform common scenarios using the latest [Azure Mobile Apps iOS SDK](https://go.microsoft.com/fwLink/?LinkID=266533&clcid=0x409).
trans-unit.target: This guide teaches you to perform common scenarios using the latest [Azure Mobile Apps iOS SDK](https://go.microsoft.com/fwLink/?LinkID=266533&clcid=0x409).

trans-unit.source: If you are new to Azure Mobile Apps, first complete [Azure Mobile Apps Quick Start] to create a backend, create a table, and download a pre-built iOS Xcode project.
trans-unit.target: If you are new to Azure Mobile Apps, first complete [Azure Mobile Apps Quick Start] to create a backend, create a table, and download a pre-built iOS Xcode project.

trans-unit.source: In this guide, we focus on the client-side iOS SDK.
trans-unit.target: In this guide, we focus on the client-side iOS SDK.

trans-unit.source: To learn more about the .NET server-side SDK for the backend, see [Work with .NET Backend](app-service-mobile-dotnet-backend-how-to-use-server-sdk.md)
trans-unit.target: To learn more about the .NET server-side SDK for the backend, see [Work with .NET Backend](app-service-mobile-dotnet-backend-how-to-use-server-sdk.md)

trans-unit.source: Reference documentation
trans-unit.target: Reference documentation

trans-unit.source: The reference documentation for the iOS client SDK is located here: [Azure Mobile Apps iOS Client Reference](http://azure.github.io/azure-mobile-services/iOS/v3/).
trans-unit.target: The reference documentation for the iOS client SDK is located here: [Azure Mobile Apps iOS Client Reference](http://azure.github.io/azure-mobile-services/iOS/v3/).

trans-unit.source: Setup and Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Setup and Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: This guide assumes that you have created a backend with a table.
trans-unit.target: This guide assumes that you have created a backend with a table.

trans-unit.source: This guide assumes that the table has the same schema as the tables in those tutorials.
trans-unit.target: This guide assumes that the table has the same schema as the tables in those tutorials.

trans-unit.source: This guide also assumes that in your code, you reference `WindowsAzureMobileServices.framework` and import `WindowsAzureMobileServices/WindowsAzureMobileServices.h`.
trans-unit.target: This guide also assumes that in your code, you reference `WindowsAzureMobileServices.framework` and import `WindowsAzureMobileServices/WindowsAzureMobileServices.h`.

trans-unit.source: How to: Create Client
trans-unit.target: How to: Create Client

trans-unit.source: To access an Azure Mobile Apps backend in your project, create an `MSClient`.
trans-unit.target: To access an Azure Mobile Apps backend in your project, create an `MSClient`.

trans-unit.source: Replace `AppUrl` with the app URL.
trans-unit.target: Replace `AppUrl` with the app URL.

trans-unit.source: You may leave `gatewayURLString` and `applicationKey` empty.
trans-unit.target: You may leave `gatewayURLString` and `applicationKey` empty.

trans-unit.source: If you set up a gateway for authentication, populate `gatewayURLString` with the gateway URL.
trans-unit.target: If you set up a gateway for authentication, populate `gatewayURLString` with the gateway URL.

trans-unit.source: How to: Create Table Reference
trans-unit.target: How to: Create Table Reference

trans-unit.source: To access or update data, create a reference to the backend table.
trans-unit.target: To access or update data, create a reference to the backend table.

trans-unit.source: Replace `TodoItem` with the name of your table.
trans-unit.target: Replace `TodoItem` with the name of your table.

trans-unit.source: How to: Query Data
trans-unit.target: How to: Query Data

trans-unit.source: To create a database query, query the `MSTable` object.
trans-unit.target: To create a database query, query the `MSTable` object.

trans-unit.source: The following query gets all the items in `TodoItem` and logs the text of each item.
trans-unit.target: The following query gets all the items in `TodoItem` and logs the text of each item.

trans-unit.source: How to: Filter Returned Data
trans-unit.target: How to: Filter Returned Data

trans-unit.source: To filter results, there are many available options.
trans-unit.target: To filter results, there are many available options.

trans-unit.source: To filter using a predicate, use an `NSPredicate` and `readWithPredicate`.
trans-unit.target: To filter using a predicate, use an `NSPredicate` and `readWithPredicate`.

trans-unit.source: The following filters returned data to find only incomplete Todo items.
trans-unit.target: The following filters returned data to find only incomplete Todo items.

trans-unit.target: How to: Use MSQuery

trans-unit.target: To perform a complex query (including sorting and paging), create an `MSQuery` object, directly or by using a predicate:

trans-unit.target: How to: Limit Fields and Expand Query String Parameters with MSQuery

trans-unit.source: How to: Insert Data
trans-unit.target: How to: Insert Data

trans-unit.source: To insert a new table row, create a new `NSDictionary` and invoke `table insert`.
trans-unit.target: To insert a new table row, create a new `NSDictionary` and invoke `table insert`.

trans-unit.source: Mobile Services automatically generates new columns based on the `NSDictionary` if [Dynamic Schema] is not disabled.
trans-unit.target: Mobile Services automatically generates new columns based on the `NSDictionary` if [Dynamic Schema] is not disabled.

trans-unit.source: If `id` is not provided, the backend automatically generates a new unique ID.
trans-unit.target: If `id` is not provided, the backend automatically generates a new unique ID.

trans-unit.source: Provide your own `id` to use email addresses, usernames, or your own custom values as ID.
trans-unit.target: Provide your own `id` to use email addresses, usernames, or your own custom values as ID.

trans-unit.source: Providing your own ID may ease joins and business-oriented database logic.
trans-unit.target: Providing your own ID may ease joins and business-oriented database logic.

trans-unit.target: How to: Modify Data

trans-unit.source: To update an existing row, modify an item and call `update`:
trans-unit.target: To update an existing row, modify an item and call `update`:

trans-unit.target: Alternatively, supply the row ID and the updated field:

trans-unit.source: At minimum, the `id` attribute must be set when making updates.
trans-unit.target: At minimum, the `id` attribute must be set when making updates.

trans-unit.source: To delete an item, invoke `delete` with the item:
trans-unit.target: To delete an item, invoke `delete` with the item:

trans-unit.target: Alternatively, delete by providing a row ID:

trans-unit.source: At minimum, the `id` attribute must be set when making deletes.
trans-unit.target: At minimum, the `id` attribute must be set when making deletes.

trans-unit.source: How to: Register push templates to send cross-platform notifications
trans-unit.target: How to: Register push templates to send cross-platform notifications

trans-unit.source: To register templates, simply pass along templates with your **client.push registerDeviceToken** method in your client app.
trans-unit.target: To register templates, simply pass along templates with your **client.push registerDeviceToken** method in your client app.

trans-unit.source: Your templates will be of type NSDictionary and can contain multiple templates in the following format:
trans-unit.target: Your templates will be of type NSDictionary and can contain multiple templates in the following format:

trans-unit.source: Note that all tags will be stripped away for security.
trans-unit.target: Note that all tags will be stripped away for security.

trans-unit.source: To add tags to installations or templates within installations, see [Work with the .NET backend server SDK for Azure Mobile Apps](app-service-mobile-dotnet-backend-how-to-use-server-sdk.md#tags).
trans-unit.target: To add tags to installations or templates within installations, see [Work with the .NET backend server SDK for Azure Mobile Apps](app-service-mobile-dotnet-backend-how-to-use-server-sdk.md#tags).

trans-unit.source: To send notifications utilizing these registered templates, work with [Notification Hubs APIs](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn495101.aspx)
trans-unit.target: To send notifications utilizing these registered templates, work with [Notification Hubs APIs](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn495101.aspx)

trans-unit.source: How to: Handle Errors
trans-unit.target: How to: Handle Errors

trans-unit.source: When you call a mobile service, the completion block contains an `NSError *error` parameter.
trans-unit.target: When you call a mobile service, the completion block contains an `NSError *error` parameter.

trans-unit.source: When an error occurs, this parameter is non-nil.
trans-unit.target: When an error occurs, this parameter is non-nil.

trans-unit.source: In your code, you should check this parameter and handle the error as needed.
trans-unit.target: In your code, you should check this parameter and handle the error as needed.

trans-unit.source: The file [`<WindowsAzureMobileServices/MSError.h>`](https://github.com/Azure/azure-mobile-services/blob/master/sdk/iOS/src/MSError.h) defines the constants `MSErrorResponseKey`, `MSErrorRequestKey`, and `MSErrorServerItemKey` to get more data related to the error.
trans-unit.target: The file [`<WindowsAzureMobileServices/MSError.h>`](https://github.com/Azure/azure-mobile-services/blob/master/sdk/iOS/src/MSError.h) defines the constants `MSErrorResponseKey`, `MSErrorRequestKey`, and `MSErrorServerItemKey` to get more data related to the error.

trans-unit.source: In addition, the file defines constants for each error code.
trans-unit.target: In addition, the file defines constants for each error code.

trans-unit.source: For an example on how to use these constants, see [Conflict-Handler] for its usage of `MSErrorServerItemKey` and `MSErrorPreconditionFailed`.
trans-unit.target: For an example on how to use these constants, see [Conflict-Handler] for its usage of `MSErrorServerItemKey` and `MSErrorPreconditionFailed`.
